Description: Ionian terracotta figure vase (plastic vase). Two joined fragments of lower body of aryballos in form of pomegranate. Wheel-made, then the surface was polished or burnished, then incised with decoration. There are possibly traces of red and black slip. Fine pale cream Ionian clay fabric with sparse fine black inclusions.
Curator's comments: Closest parallel for this small fragment are the two early 6th century BC examples from Kamiros BM 1861,1024.11 and BM 1839,1109.10, purchased in Campanari. Both originally thought to be of Rhodian origin, like this example (Higgins 1959: 30-31). Same fabric as BM1888,0601.752, BM1888,0601.752b and BM1888,0601.752.c also from Naukratis. Jones' Optical Emission Spectroscopy analysis of BM1888,0601.752.b places it within his Ionian B group. Jones, R.E., Greek and Cypriot pottery: a review of scientific studies, Athens, 1986; p.668-70
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (1654)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.026) (Phase 3)
